name: aws-waf
label: AWS WAF
description: AWS WAF is a web application firewall that lets you monitor and manage web requests that are forwarded to protected AWS resources.

fields.title: Scope
fields.name: Scope
fields.tooltip: Specify whether this is for an amazon cloud front distribution or for a regional application. Note if cloud front is specified US East (N. Virginia) region will be used.
fields.description: Specify whether this is for an amazon cloud front distribution or for a regional application. Note if cloud front is specified US East (N. Virginia) region will be used.

Regional.title: Region
Regional.name: aws_region
Regional.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS WAF services.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.description:
AWS configuration type that determines the authentication mechanism that you will use to provide credentials and access AWS WAF. You can choose either IAM Role or Access Credentials to connect to AWS. AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role is an IAM entity that defines a set of permissions for making AWS service requests. IAM roles are not associated with a specific user or group. Instead, trusted entities assume roles, such as IAM users, applications, or AWS services.If you choose IAM Role, then you must specify the following parameter:
			
AWS Instance IAM Role: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.

			If you choose Access Credentials, then you must specify the following parameters:

			
Access Key: The AWS Access Key to access AWS services. 
Secret Key: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.

IAM Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role
IAM Role.name: aws_iam_role
IAM Role.tooltip: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services
IAM Role.description: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: Access Key
Access Credentials.name: access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: The AWS Access Key to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: The AWS Access Key to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: Secret Key
Access Credentials.name: secret_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Create IP Set
operations.description: Creates an IP set, which you use to identify web requests that originate from specific IP addresses or ranges of IP addresses.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the IP set. You cannot change the name of an IP set after you create it.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the IP set. You cannot change the name of an IP set after you create it.

parameters.title: IP Address Version
parameters.name: IPAddressVersion
parameters.tooltip: Specify the version of the IP addresses, either IPV4 or IPV6.
parameters.description: Specify the version of the IP addresses, either IPV4 or IPV6.

parameters.title: IP Addresses
parameters.name: Addresses
parameters.tooltip: Specify one or more IP addresses as comma separated values, that you want AWS WAF to inspect for in incoming requests.
parameters.description: Specify one or more IP addresses as comma separated values, that you want AWS WAF to inspect for in incoming requests.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: Description
parameters.tooltip: Specify a description of the IP set that helps with identification.
parameters.description: Specify a description of the IP set that helps with identification.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: Tags
parameters.tooltip: Specify tags to associate with the resource. Tags can be used to categorize and manage your resources.
parameters.description: Specify tags to associate with the resource. Tags can be used to categorize and manage your resources.

operations.title: Update IP Set
operations.description: Updates the specified IP set based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the IP set to update. Note you cannot change the name of an IP set after you create it.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the IP set to update. Note you cannot change the name of an IP set after you create it.

parameters.title: ID
parameters.name: Id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the IP set to update.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the IP set to update.

parameters.title: Lock Token
parameters.name: LockToken
parameters.tooltip: Specify the token used for optimistic locking. WAF returns a token to your get and list IP set requests, to mark the state of the entity at the time of the request.
parameters.description: Specify the token used for optimistic locking. WAF returns a token to your get and list IP set requests, to mark the state of the entity at the time of the request.

parameters.title: IP Addresses To Add
parameters.name: AddressesToAdd
parameters.tooltip: Specify one or more IP addresses as comma separated values, that you want AWS WAF to inspect for in incoming requests.
parameters.description: Specify one or more IP addresses as comma separated values, that you want AWS WAF to inspect for in incoming requests.

parameters.title: IP Addresses To Remove
parameters.name: AddressesToRemove
parameters.tooltip: Specify one or more IP addresses as comma separated values, that you want AWS WAF to inspect for in incoming requests.
parameters.description: Specify one or more IP addresses as comma separated values, that you want AWS WAF to inspect for in incoming requests.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: Description
parameters.tooltip: Specify a description of the IP set that helps with identification.
parameters.description: Specify a description of the IP set that helps with identification.

operations.title: List IP Set
operations.description: Retrieves an array of IP set Summary objects for the IP sets that you manage.

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.name: Limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of objects that you want WAF to return for this request. If more objects are available, in the response, WAF provides a NextMarker value that you can use in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects.
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of objects that you want WAF to return for this request. If more objects are available, in the response, WAF provides a NextMarker value that you can use in a subsequent call to get the next batch of objects.

parameters.title: Next Marker
parameters.name: NextMarker
parameters.tooltip: Specify the marker from the prior call to retrieve the next batch of objects.
parameters.description: Specify the marker from the prior call to retrieve the next batch of objects.

operations.title: Get IP Set
operations.description: Retrieves the specified IP set based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the IP set to retrieve.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the IP set to retrieve.

parameters.title: ID
parameters.name: Id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the IP set to retrieve.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the IP set to retrieve.

operations.title: Delete IP Set
operations.description: Deletes the specified IP set based on the input parameters specified.

parameters.title: Name
parameters.name: Name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the IP set to delete.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the IP set to delete.

parameters.title: ID
parameters.name: Id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the ID of the IP set to delete.
parameters.description: Specify the ID of the IP set to delete.

parameters.title: Lock Token
parameters.name: LockToken
parameters.tooltip: Specify the token used for optimistic locking. WAF returns a token to your get and list IP set requests, to mark the state of the entity at the time of the request.
parameters.description: Specify the token used for optimistic locking. WAF returns a token to your get and list IP set requests, to mark the state of the entity at the time of the request.
